Title:
Diaporthe species associated with peach constriction canker
in China, with two new species described
Keywords:
Constriction canker, Diaporthe, phylogeny, taxonomy, 2 new
taxa
Abstract:
A total of 52 strains of the genus Diaporthe were obtained
by pathogen isolation and single spore culture from the infected buds of
peach trees showing constriction canker symptoms in Fujian Province,
China. Phylogenetic analyses using comparisons of DNA sequence data for
the internal transcribed spacer of the ribosomal DNA (ITS), translation
elongation factor 1-α (TEF), ß-tubulin (TUB), histone (HIS), and
calmodulin (CAL) gene regions, as well as their morphological features
revealed two novel taxa, D. zaofenghuang and D. jinxiu and five known
species, D. eres, D. caryae, D. hongkongensis, D. unshiuensis and D.
cercidis. The current study improves the understanding of species
causing constriction canker and provides useful information for the
effective disease management of peach in China.
